dataList.content: You returned to me after some time... and spoke strange things.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: Yi Sang. When Gubo comes back with that blue supplement... keep it stored instead of swallowing it right away.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: After around three days of doing so... you'll start seeing things you couldn't before.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: When that day comes, you will have two options.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: The first is to chew up all the supplements you've gathered.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: It will put you into a deep sleep. But when you wake, everything will return to normalcy. You'll spend your days wholly dedicated to the mirror technology like this, chatting with me from time to time. The status quo will be preserved.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: The second... is to leave this place.
I lack the wings to do so. How will I accomplish that?

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: A chicken may not be able to fly, but that doesn't stop it from flapping its wings.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: It struggles... endlessly.
You perplex me. At this point in time... where must I even go? I have neither a hometown nor an awaiter to return to.

dataList.title: Yeonsim
dataList.content: Be straightforward. If there is no hometown, you can walk ceaselessly until your feet decide to stop, and make that your new home.
I followed your words and avoided taking the blue supplements.
Once I stopped taking the supplements, what had only been a blur carved a clear image onto my retina for the first time.
The room I was in was not closed. It has always been open, and I had the freedom to go anywhere.
Walking through the long and narrow hallway, I saw how my mirror was being used.
Then, a sudden wave of lassitude began to surge.
If I took the supplements and fell asleep, everything would have stayed alright.
And I wished to believe that there must have been a misunderstanding between Gubo and me.
Alas...
I stepped outside the white square and kept walking.
